Description.val: The Common Defensive Weapon System (CDWS) consists of a GAU-21 .50 caliber Machine Gun, cradle, ammo box, feed/link chutes and a platform specific mount system. For the MV-22 CDWS, which will commence production in FY 2014, Ramp Mount Weapon Systems (RMWS) will be procured.  For the UH-1Y Platform, which is out of production, Defense Armament System (DAS) mounts were procured. For the CH-53D/E Platforms, which is out of production, window mounts and ramp mounts were procured.  CDWS was procured to replace obsolete GAU-16 and XM-218 .50 caliber Machine Guns. CDWS enhances the warfighters overall capability by providing a safer, more reliable and accurate weapon system with a higher rate of fire.

Justification.val:
FY 2014 funding will procure 46 modified Ramp Mounted Weapon System (RMWS) for the MV-22 aircraft resulting in a $3.6M increase in funding from FY 2013.

FY 2015 funding will procure 26 modified RMWS for the MV-22 aircraft.

Name.@footnote: [Other Support] Procurement of the gun system starts in FY 2014. First fielding and support requires non-recurring investment for Operator/Armorer training, tooling, and on-site support for first install. This along with introducing the systems at United States Marine Corps major Command elements will be completed using FY 2014 support dollars. Support cost for the follow on procurements does not require the same level of support. This is reflected in the reduction in FY 2015 though FY 2018 support cost in the budget.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION: The Common Defensive Weapon System (CDWS) consists of a GAU-21 .50 caliber Machine Gun, cradle, ammo box, feed/link chutes and a platform specific mount system. For the MV-22 CDWS, which will commence production in FY 2014, Ramp Mount Weapon Systems (RMWS) will be procured. For the UH-1Y Platform, which is out of production, Defense Armament System (DAS) mounts were procured. For the CH-53D/E Platforms, which is out of production, window mounts and ramp mounts were procured.  CDWS was procured to replace obsolete GAU-16 and XM-218 .50 caliber Machine Guns. CDWS enhances the warfighters overall capability by providing a safer, more reliable and accurate weapon system with a higher rate of fire.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: The CDWS integration onto the MV-22 ramp will be completed in FY 2014 with full-rate procurement starting in FY 2014.
